text: You can now run Kimi K2 locally with our Dynamic 1.8-bit GGUFs! We shrank the full 1.1TB model to just 245GB (-80% size reduction). The 2-bit XL GGUF performs exceptionally well on coding & passes all our code tests Guide: https://docs.unsloth.ai/basics/kimi-k2 GGUFs: https://huggingface.co/unsloth/Kimi-K2-Instruct-GGUF…
author: Unsloth AI

text: Imagine finding out your girlfriend is your boss’s wife on a professional call after she told you she was divorced

text: Fully autonomous self laundry folding robot folds 16 t-shirts averaging 2 mins per t-shirt. Give it crumpled clothes straight from the dryer and it folds and stacks your t-shirts with zero human aid. Join our waitlist, prototype available for home and business @7Xrobotics
author: Usman Roshan

text: Behind the scenes of my latest video, where I do a virtual try-on effect. I am currently working on a tutorial on how I made this. This was created using Wan2.1 Vace for video-to-video generation, PikaLabs for the transitions, and Sora for the image references.

author: GLIF

text: 24 hours of non-stop stress-testing, Kimi-K2-Instruct cleared every benchmark in our playbook. Now it’s LIVE on the Fireworks Serverless API It is the first open-weights SOTA agentic tool-caller, holding its own on SWE Bench, Tau2 & AceBench. Same prod weights, zero infra
author: Benny (Yufei) Chen

text: We built drones that fly without GPS, without radio, without fear. Now you can build with the same tech. Introducing JETCORE — our compute module for real-time AI at the edge. Trusted in the field. Built for your autonomy stack. Available now: http://store.vecros.com

text: It is cool to be capable. It is cool to know shit. That's why the HF team is open-sourcing not just the model, but the training code and datasets too. Learn. Build. Make it your own.

text: Google just dropped its first Gemini Embedding text model. Supports 100+ languages, 2048 token limit, and tops the MTEB Multilingual leaderboard. Priced at $0.15 per 1M tokens with free tier available.

text: The new meta for building anything in July 2025: - Planning: Grok-4 to make TDD file - Coding: Sonnet-4 and Gemini 2.5 - IDE: Claude Code or Cursor - Frontend: React in Lovable - Backend: n8n if you can’t code, Python & FastAPI if you can - AI Orchestration: LangChain -
author: vas

text: Orange Slice (@orangesliceai) uses AI agents to find companies that already want to buy your product. Their agents scan the entire web 24/7 to deliver qualified leads with clear details to help you close deals faster. Congrats on the launch, @kishansripada & @vihaarnandigala!

text: You know what's better than Claude Code? 4 Claude Code agents working together Here is my multi-agent setup (and how you can do the same)

text: Reinforcement Learning of Large Language Models, Spring 2025(UCLA) Great set of new lectures on reinforcement learning of LLMs. Covers a wide range of topics related to RLxLLMs such as basics/foundations, test-time compute, RLHF, and RL with verifiable rewards(RLVR).
author: Jean de Nyandwi

text: Claude Code pro tip: Use Kimi K2 as your agent by changing the base URL and setting the API key before running claude. all prompts and code requests will now go through Kimi, in the CC terminal you're used to!
author: Ian Nuttall

text: After testing @Kimi_Moonshot K2 for a few hours, My overall take: - Performance between Claude 3.5 & Claude 4 (Just my vibe eval!) - The UI generation seems great - But the cost is only 20% of Claude 3.5 - So good enough for most coding agent with a lot more manageable cost
author: Jason Zhou
